channel.title: How to not let other people edit my client
channel.description: Ok, so this is my very first time editing a client and i dont know how to let other people download it without them being able to edit the client. i relly need help on this because i havn't coded in like 2 years so if you could make it a really easy tutorial that would be super cool :cool:

item.title: How to not let other people edit my client
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

how the fuck can you deobfuscate source code? You can deobfuscate byte code, but not source code.

You will have to “aquire” the obfuscater since most have expensive licenses with them.

Read full topic
item.source: How to not let other people edit my client

item.title: How to not let other people edit my client
item.dc:creator: @ugn ugn
item.description:
@ugn wrote:

hey epic how to deobsfucate a client??

Read full topic
item.source: How to not let other people edit my client

item.title: How to not let other people edit my client
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Codez Epic Codez
item.description:
@Epic_Codez wrote:

You can just delete the .java files that will prevent newbies at java from editing/hacking your client, or if you want to go a little more advanced you could deobsfucate your client which makes it harder to decompile.

Read full topic
item.source: How to not let other people edit my client

item.title: How to not let other people edit my client
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

No, only the .java files, not the .class. The .class files is the MAIN part of your client, besides the cache. Also, thanks for noticing about my Uncle Tom, RIP ur Nana as well.

Read full topic
item.source: How to not let other people edit my client

item.title: How to not let other people edit my client
item.dc:creator: @Mark112 Mark112
item.description:
@Mark112 wrote:

so i make a copy of the client, then delete all the .class files and .java files? and rip ur uncle tom, my NaNa passed away not to far from that

Read full topic
item.source: How to not let other people edit my client

item.title: How to not let other people edit my client
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Well, most people who will play other servers dont have the knowledge to decompile the .class files. Just delete all .java files, and compile.bat files, and your client is not as easily editable. Because when you decompile all of the .class files it will give them some errors.

Read full topic
item.source: How to not let other people edit my client
